document.heading: Office of the Inspector General Powers and Duties Amendment Act of 1999

history.narrative: Law 13-71, the “Office of the Inspector General Powers and Duties Amendment Act of 1999,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-143, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 21, 1999, and October 5, 1999, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 25, 1999, it was assigned Act No. 13-181 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-71 became effective on April 5, 2000.
